data.text: Does a Suspension Seat Post Work with Saddle Bags?
Hello bikepackers! Need advise, have you tried and does suspension seat post work with saddle bags (like Ortlieb)? Types of seat post in photos. Thanks
Following
data.author: David Killmore

data.text: I don’t know the answer to the question but want to mention how strange some of these posts feel when you first put them in a bike. I have a similar post on my town ebike and the action of the suspension changes the effective top tube length, it feels like your frame broke or something. You get used to it but it’s a weird feeling when you first use one.

data.text: Have tried the Blackburn outpost, the alpkit koala and the ortlieb, on the Thudbuster LT and ST. All of them ended up with a small hole on the tip from rubbing even with the protection sleeve. Nothing dramatic, really easy to repair with the Tenacious Sealing & Repair Tape by McNett, and Tenacious Tape Max by McNett.

data.text: The cane creek eesilk was incredible until one of the pins blew out 600 miles into the TDR last year and ultimately led to me scratching. I would think twice before taking a suspension seatpost on all long multi day self supported race. Seatposts really take a beating. I weigh about 160 lbs and did not have much weight in the saddle bag (rain gear and my puffy). With that said my red shift stem is incredible and has held up very well.
